page.description: Redis is a service primarily for communication between programs, be it through shared data, or through communication through either *[Lists]* or *[Channels]*.

section.title: Redis to Share Data between Processes

description.p: One way in which Redis is used is to share data between applications.
For example, IIS has an implementation of session storage that is built on top of Redis.

figure.alt: Redis used to store shared 'memory' between applications.

description.p: Redis has support for blocking atomic reads on list.
Being able to data being de-queued by a single process makes it possible to build work queues.

figure.alt: Redis used as an event queue between applications.

description.p: Redis has support for publish/subscribe pattern through use of 'channels'.
Being able to broadcast messages makes it possible to build realtime applications like message boards and messaging applications.

figure.alt: Redis used to broadcast realtime messages between applications.
